basic_info.description: My name is Patrick Alvarez. After five years in the fine dining world, I made the switch to software engineering in January 2022. This change was driven by my passion for problem solving and the desire to create something meaningful. My background in theatre and hospitality gives me a unique advantage in forging connections with new people and delivering unparalleled customer service, and during my time at General Assembly I gained proficiency in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Python with a focus on the MERN tech stack.

projects.title: Happy houR
projects.description: A full-stack application with its own API utilizing Mongoose, Express, React, Node.js, CSS, Bootstrap, the Google Maps API, Google Places API, and the Google Geocoder API. The app allows bars and restaurants to log happy hours with information about deals, location, hours, and tags. Guests can then search for happy hours by location or by tag, view their information along with a map to the location and user reviews, and add/remove happy hours to a favorites list that they can then access.

projects.title: The Adventurer's Spellbook
projects.description: A full-stack application using Node.js, JavaScript, Mongoose, Express, Liquid, CSS, and Bootstrap that serves as a companion to Dungeons and Dragons 5th edition. The app allows users to create, view, and update characters, add a list of spells pulled from a third-party API to the characters, and create their own custom spells.
